case_vignette:
A 25-year-old man comes to the physician for the evaluation of recurrent episodes of nosebleeds over the past 6 months. The nosebleeds occur spontaneously and stop after 10 minutes after pinching the nose at the nostrils. He has no history of serious illness except for prolonged bleeding following wisdom teeth extraction 2 years ago. He does not smoke or drink alcohol. He takes no medications. Vital signs are within normal limits. Examination of the nose shows no abnormalities. There are several bruises on the lower extremities. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 15 g/dL
Leukocyte count 6,000/mm3
Platelet count 220,000/mm3
Bleeding time 9 minutes
Prothrombin time 13 sec
Partial thromboplastin time 55 sec
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I keep getting nosebleeds that happen without any clear reason and I've been experiencing them for the past 6 months.
How old are you?
I am 25 years old.
Have you had any unusual bruising or bleeding in other parts of your body?
Yes, I have several bruises on my lower legs.
Have you noticed any lumps or swelling in your neck, underarms, or groin?
The rest of my examination showed no abnormalities, so no lumps or swelling.
Do you have a family history of bleeding disorders or other medical conditions?
I haven't mentioned any family history of medical conditions.
Understood. Are you currently taking any medications or supplements?
No, I'm not taking any medications or supplements.
**Final Diagnosis:** Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura
